Current Phone Number: 303 399 8020
 
Age:  55
Sex:  FEMALE
 
VITAL SIGNS:
   Temperature:    100.6 degrees F
   Pulse:          110 beats per minute
   Respiration:    20 breaths per minute
   Blood Pressure: 104/33
   Weight:         * lbs
   Pulse Oximetry  93 Room Air
   Pain:           0
 
 
 
Current Medications:
Computer is the source for the following medication list:
 
 
Active and Recently Expired Outpatient Medications (excluding Supplies):
 
     Active Outpatient Medications                          Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE (S)
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500MG     ACTIVE
       TABLET(S) BY MOUTH EVERY 8 HOURS
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE ONE-HALF TABLET BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       DAY
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE ONE CAPSULE BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
 
 
  Did the patient take own medications this AM? Yes
 
On arrival the patient was: Ambulatory
 
Allergies are listed in CPRS as: METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
When asked about allergic reactions, patient reports: see postings
 
 
Mentation:  Alert and oriented to person, place, and time
 
Mental Health: 
   History of emotional/behavioral difficulties? None/Patient denies. 
   Suicide Risk Screening:
     1. In the past 2 weeks, have you been feeling down, depressed, or 
        hopeless?  no 
     2. During that time, have you had thoughts of hurting yourself in 
        some way?  no 
     3. In the past 2 weeks, have you had thoughts of killing yourself, 
        or planning your own death?  no 
   Elopement risk factors present? none
 
Homeless: No 
 
Is Visit due to injury: No 
 
Triage:
S/O nonproductive cough, sob, weakness x3 days, low grade 
temp, tachy
 
Triage Level: ESI 3
text.author: NURSE,EIGHT
